subject: Procurement of Digital Signature Certificate for NHAI Officers /Officials -reg.
text: HRa 75f4 RTHRifgiferazrut (Tes 4Raav #r RTTrf HERT, #ra TraT) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) HcYHa T4a 0-5 & 6, #qzr-10, ErqT, 75 @oalt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, Delhi-110075 Ti /Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI Policy Guidelines 1 IT 2025 Policy Circular No.6.42/2025 dated June, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/IT/e-office/ DSC.202I / (Comp. No. 59145)} Sub: Procurement of Digital Signature Certificate for NHAI Officers /Officials -reg The use of Digital Signature Certificates (DSCs) has become integral to the functioning of the Organisation particularly for activities such as e-Tendering, e-Office Operations, GeM Transactions, Project approvals and other Secure Digital Communications. In view of the growing reliance on Digital Workflows, it is essential to establish a uniform Policy governing the Procurement and Reimbursement of DSCs across all Offices of NHAI: 2 To ensure convenience in Procurement, Cost-effectiveness and Compliance with prevailing Standards, it has been decided that all Officials of NHAI both at Headquarters and Field Offices may procure Class III DSCs for 1/2 years (as required) directly from any licensed Certifying Authorities (CAs) licensed under the Controller of Certifying Authorities (CCA), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY) Government of India. 3_ Standardized Reimbursement  Structure: The Invoice in Original  shall be  submitted for reimbursement subject to following maximum Ceiling Rates (excluding applicable Taxes): Class-III DSC Class-III DSC Description 1-year validity) (2-year validity) Total Cost (excluding tax) Rs_ 3,350/ Rs. 3,6007 Note: Taxes paid as per actuals will be reimbursed in addition to the above-stated ceilings subject to submission of valid Tax Invoices. 4_ The concerned Officials must retain all supporting Documentation including Invoice(s) and Proof of Payment for Reimbursement Claims. Claims shall be processed as per the Standard Procedures applicable for Administrative Reimbursements. 5. This Circular supersedes all previous Circulars, Orders or Communications issued on the Subject of Procurement and Reimbursement of Digital Signature Certificates including Circular No. 13012/06/2017/1T/4 dated 04.08.2017(Annexure-I). 6. This issue with the approval of Competent Authority: Encl:: As stated above. b6/2 (CS.
